text: I'm Ashley Parker and I've been covering
mitt romney's presidential campaign for
over a year the time between the
conventions in election day seemed to
fly by covering the Republicans in Tampa
we saw a cast of interesting characters
a member of the California delegation
dressed up like an elephant in one of
Romney's top Iowa staffers Dave Cottrill
working the floor is whip in a green
Romney cap we were there when Ann Romney
gave her speech and there when she shook
hands with fans in the crowd when the
balloons dropped from the rafters on the
final night we knew it was time to head
to Charlotte where President Obama
energized his own crowd with his keynote
convention speech and then it was back
on the campaign trail for the final
stretch driving in La Jolla in route to
a fundraiser we passed a huge Mormon
temple as we whizzed along the highway
the place where Romney and his family
worship when they're at their California
beach home Romney also came to the back
of his plane from time to time to talk
with us and we got to see his campaign
roll out some new messaging like the
45-foot jobs letters in Virginia after
Romney handedly won his first debate his
team put on a huge rally complete with
fireworks that felt like a summer
concert and of course traveling through
swing states like Ohio we relied on old
staples like the Waffle House for voter
chitchat and lunch there were autumn
rallies and streets packed with people
waiting to see the romney-ryan ticket
sometimes they even packed the balconies
like at this rally at an old Ohio hotel
owned by senator Rob Portman's family
after all the stakes were high and
everyone was rooting for their guy be a
Barack Obama or Mitt Romney to win on
Election Day
you
